summary: The document is a declassified record associated with the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It details a recruitment attempt in August 1977 by an individual, Victor Paneque, who claimed to be a CIA operative and a Bay of Pigs veteran, in Bluefields. The record includes discussions on Paneque's interactions with a Peace Corps volunteer, his behavior, especially when drunk, and references to intelligence operations in the area.
key_findings: Recruitment attempt by a self-claimed CIA operative in 1977.
Victor Paneque identified himself as a CIA agent and Bay of Pigs veteran.
Details on Paneque's heavy drinking and behavior when drunk.
Document released under the JFK Assassination Records Act of 1992.
References to Peace Corps activities and intelligence operations in Bluefields.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act
